A classic from Valve! In my opinion, everyone who plays videogames NEED to play Half Life at least once.

Wow, what a game. What I got out of this game was enjoyment / boredom at some points. I loved the bright open parts but the dark parts were not doing it for me. As my first half life completion. I say this game is worth your money. It is a good game to play or even replay if you are struck with boredom. I held off the half life series for 10 years and I am so glad I checked it out. This game does and always will deserve a 10/10/

Thank you for creating this masterpiece, Valve
its honestly just fucking amazing.It has such a good story and amazing details
It's Half Life 2, you already know it's good
Well enjoyable and.. dude just fucking buy it trust me its worth every penny
Amazing game. I bought this probably before steam really recognizes..

Off the bat, this game hasn't aged bad at all. The gun play isn't anything to right home about, but the gravity puzzles and combat was amazing. The story and world is the real treat here. The gameplay just adds enough to make you feel as if you're actually there.

6.5/10. A mostly boring adventure riding on the coattails of the original Half-Life. The longest road ever, taking you through a linear journey of sewers, zombies, buildings. So easy to get lost or miss that next ladder or hallway. I don't love the continuation of the story. Half-Life had a better story and the Combine are a lazy blend of tropes of sci-fi. You never feel any sort of compassion for Breen. Some redeeming qualities are the physics of the gravity gun, the early fun in the boat, and the atmosphere of the Citadel reminds me of parts of Fallout 3 or the Deus Ex series. I wish I had not played this game for 26 hours and I can't get that time back in my life, but I would encourage anyone. At this point, I've played HL1, Opposing Force, Blue Shift, HL2. Will I try the remaining couple additions to the series? Maybe, just to complete it. HL2 is the worst so far. Did you know this game is somehow the #1 PC game on Metacritic?

One of the best 1st person shooters i have ever played. On my second run of the game. The difficulty is balanced and normal actually feels appropriately named. Not too easy and not too hard.

lo recomiendo nomas pq tiene cromos XD
ni lo jugue solamente lo deje abierto para que me farmee los cromos ashe

Pros
- For a game that is extremely linear, HL2 still allows you to figure stuff out for yourself. Letting you play around with game mechanics, until you reach the goal. Guiding without hand-holding.

- HL2 tends to be more immersive than many modern day shooters with a few simple game design choices. The exclusion of a minimap is one of those choices.

- Gravity Gun

- Succeeds in crafting a rich lore behind HL2 by only showing the player what needs to be revealed and leaving everything else to the imagination.

- Gordon Freeman's presentation as a game protagonist is simply perfect. Valve went above and beyond to let players project themselves on the physicist, especially with him being in cryogenic slumber the whole time between HL1 and HL2, he does not know what has conspired in the years between. Gordon must piece everything together along with the player in a home that feels alien.

Cons
- Lighting in the vanilla version as of 2021 is simply terrible.Places feel weirdly "uniformly well lit" as if there are studio lights in every corner. Fortunately, this wasn't the original lighting in the game afaik. Older videos have much better use of lighting as a guiding tool through the levels.

- Gunplay hasn't aged well. The assault rifle is especially terrible. The Shotgun and the crossbow are the only things that feel ok. Of course this does not apply to the magical gravity gun.

- Use of Infinite enemies to force the player to rush through certain areas, excepting the antlions in the Highway 17 chapters. Using infinite enemies is just bad game design in my books and I am happy to see it is a practice we have mostly left behind.

- Squad AI. Let's just say I was better off alone.


In the meantime... this is where I get off.
Literally one of the best games of all time
A veteran for adventure shooters. Interesting story, peculiar mechanics and game engine. Good action and a good challenge. A classic.

HL2. It's great.

Second installment in an incredible series, and one of my most favorite series to boot, too.
The combine is eerie, that AI is smart, and the music, wow, the music.

Need I say more, it's incredible.
